explanation: The report is not correct. The ARGCHECK used by OS_CHECK_SIZE is ARGCHECK((val)>0 && (val)<(UINT32_MAX/2), ...). Even on targets where SIZE_MAX < (UINT32_MAX/2) the right-hand comparison (val < UINT32_MAX/2) will indeed be true for all possible size_t values, but the overall conjunction still depends on (val > 0). Thus the condition can be false (and the error-handling branch executed) when val == 0. In other words the failure path is reachable at runtime (e.g. when nbytes == 0), so there is no unreachable code introduced here that would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1. (Separately, using SIZE_MAX for a size_t upper bound would be a clearer/portable guard, but the current code does not produce unreachable code as claimed.)
